contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}} {{For|the named passenger train jointly-operated by the Canadian National Railway and the Grand Trunk Western Railroad|International Limited}} {{for|the train operated by Amtrak and Via Rail between Chicago and Toronto|International Limited}} {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} [[File:Great Northern The International parlor lounge car 1950.JPG|thumb|Photo of the parlor car "Port of Vancouver" in 1950. The train's other similar car was called "Port of Seattle".]] The '''''International''''' was a [[List of named passenger trains|named passenger train]] originally operated by the [[Great Northern Railway (U.S.)|Great Northern Railway]] between [[Seattle, Washington]], and [[Vancouver, British Columbia]]. This route began in 1950 as the '''''International Limited''''', and was restored in 1995 using a [[Talgo]] Pendular train set purchased by the [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]] State Department of Transportation (WSDOT) as Amtrak's ''Mount Baker International'' service and is still in operation as part of its ''[[Amtrak Cascades]]'' train. The train makes stops in [[Seattle, Washington|Seattle]], [[Edmonds, Washington|Edmonds]], [[Mount Vernon, Washington|Mount Vernon]] and [[Bellingham, Washington]], before crossing the international boundary for [[Vancouver, British Columbia]]. {{DEFAULTSORT:International (train}} [[Category:Passenger trains of the Great Northern Railway (U.S.)]] [[Category:Named passenger trains of Canada]] [[Category:Named passenger trains of the United States]] [[Category:Railway services introduced in 1950]] {{Canada-rail-transport-stub}} {{US-train-stub}}
